overview: From 2025-05-22 to 2025-05-23, elizaos/eliza had 19 new PRs (14 merged), 0 new issues, and 14 active contributors.

topPRs.title: feat: Knowledge Plugin
topPRs.author: lalalune
topPRs.body:
This PR moves the code for knowledge into the RAG plugin and renames that to the knowledge plugin

So now the agent will be able to process knowledge optionally with the plugin installed, completely removing it from the runtime

topPRs.body: Add: Execute Buys on strategies using plugin-jupiter

topPRs.title: chore: centralise env resolution further
topPRs.author: wtfsayo
topPRs.body:
<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
## Summary by CodeRabbit

- **New Features**
  - Introduced new utilities for resolving environment files and database directories, improving consistency across the project.

- **Refactor**
  - Updated default data directory for local databases from `.pglite` to `.elizadb` throughout the application and documentation.
  - Centralized and streamlined environment and path resolution, making directory management project-relative instead of user home-relative.
  - Simplified and unified server and database initialization logic for improved modularity.
  - Enhanced template resolution in development environments by detecting monorepo roots for more reliable path handling.
  - Replaced synchronous environment loading with asynchronous flows for improved startup and test execution.

- **Bug Fixes**
  - Enhanced handling of environment variable and data directory resolution to prevent misconfiguration.
  - Added precondition checks in tests to skip when required model files are missing.

- **Documentation**
  - Updated documentation to reflect the new default database directory and improved configuration instructions.

- **Chores**
  - Adjusted ignore patterns to exclude new database directories and environment files at any depth.
<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

topPRs.title: Docker improvements
topPRs.author: UD1sto
topPRs.body:
This PR improves TypeScript support and build reliability by adding scripts to automatically fix common TypeScript errors and validate configuration files.

Key changes:
- Add lightweight build verification script
- Add tsconfig.json validation script
- Add script to automatically fix common TypeScript errors
- Update Dockerfile with better TypeScript support and build reliability
- Add Bun configuration for workspace resolution

Depends on #4329 but can be pushed forward without it.

topPRs.title: feat: Configure Tauri for multi-platform CI/CD and mobile support
topPRs.author: lalalune
topPRs.body:
This commit introduces comprehensive updates to enable building, testing, and releasing your Tauri application (`packages/app`) across desktop (Linux, macOS, Windows) and mobile (Android, iOS) platforms.

Key changes include:

1.  **Tauri Configuration (`packages/app/src-tauri/tauri.conf.json`):**
    *   I updated the Content Security Policy (CSP) to allow connections to the
        designated mobile backend (`https://api.eliza.how`).
    *   I added initial (placeholder) configurations for Android and iOS to
        prepare for mobile builds.

2.  **Mobile Dependencies (`packages/app/src-tauri/Cargo.toml`):**
    *   I added `tauri-plugin-mobile` to support mobile-specific functionalities.

3.  **CI Workflow (`tauri-ci.yml`):**
    *   I expanded the test build matrix to include `macos-latest` and
        `windows-latest` alongside `ubuntu-latest`.
    *   I added installation of WebView2 for Windows runners.
    *   I ensured `tauri build --debug` runs for all desktop platforms.

4.  **Release Workflow (`tauri-release.yml`):**
    *   I significantly enhanced this to support multi-platform releases:
        *   **Windows Desktop:** Uncommented and configured.
        *   **Android:** Added new job with JDK, Android SDK/NDK setup.
          Builds APKs (currently unsigned with a dummy keystore).
        *   **iOS:** Added new job for `macos-latest`. Builds IPAs
          (placeholder steps for code signing).
    *   I installed necessary dependencies (WebView2 for Windows, Java/Android
        tools for Android).
    *   I added required Rust targets for all platforms.
    *   I configured artifact uploading for all platforms (`.AppImage`, `.deb`,
        `.dmg`, `.exe`, `.apk`, `.ipa`).
    *   I updated the GitHub Release step to include all generated artifacts.
    *   I included placeholders for Android and iOS signing secrets.

5.  **Documentation (`README.md`):**
    *   I added a new section "Tauri Application CI/CD and Signing" detailing
        the CI/CD setup, the external backend strategy for mobile, and the
        list of required GitHub secrets for proper app signing on Android
        and iOS.

This work assumes your mobile applications will connect to an external server (`https://api.eliza.how`) rather than bundling the Node.js backend. The CI workflows now provide a robust foundation for building and distributing your application across all targeted platforms. Further work will be needed to implement full mobile signing by adding the required secrets to the GitHub repository.

completedItems.title: fix: filter for :user in client chat ignores
completedItems.body:
`content: { text: 'hello', source: 'client_chat:user' }`

Ignore was not being respected because client_chat gets `:user` appended to the string in CLI server handleSocket code.

This parses everything instead with includes.

completedItems.title: add .env to plugin-starter's .gitignore file (publishing was failing due to key presence)
completedItems.body:
**Problem**
